intro: Deinbollia ramiflora, commonly known as the branching leaf vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Deinbollia ramiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and thickets.
